Our guest today is Louis Segaloff, formerly editor and
publisher of the weekly Kyushu Herald, A former Mr Force
officer, Louis has travelled widely in South East Asia,
married a Japanese, and lived how long in Japan?
About 5 years.....
The first time I saw your name in print, Louis, was in con¬
nection with a striking article entitled* Why I married a
Japanese. I imagine you’ve had a lot of response to that
article.
From all over Japan and Korea.
And before we turn to your current article, I wonder if
you would sum up your stand, as it were, on the marriage
question.
You present Japan, Louis, in this article as the potential
and active target for propaganda from both sides: Communist
and Free World. Ninety million highly literate people
bombarded with views through newspapers, books, pamphlets,
posters,.speeches, radio and television.
Yes. The high literacy rate, the highest per capita owner¬
ship of radio sets in Asia, their "open-ness” to cultural
information make the Japanese an accessible target.
